newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq shares flat amid cautious tech trading.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq shares flat amid cautious tech trading.

text.p: Nasdaq shares ended little changed after strong results in Hewlett-Packard Co failed to spark interest in technology shares, traders said.
The Nasdaq composite index slipped 0.20 points or 0.01 percent to an unofficial close of 1365.59. The Dow industrials dropped about 47 points from Tuesday's record high to close unofficially at 7020.

"Hewlett-Packard had a great day, but there was some hesitancy in technology shares otherwise. Normally, a jump like that in a name like H-P would pull others much higher. The fact that it didn't means there's some uncertainty in techs right now," one trader said.
Hewlett-Packard gained 7-3/8 to 56-7/8 after a strong first quarter earnings report. Other technology shares were mixed. Microsoft Corp gained 1/8 to 97-1/2. Intel Corp lost 3/4 to 153-7/8.
Shares of C-Cube Microsystems Inc tumbled after a news report on the company's market share and growth prospects was viewed as negative by investors. C-Cube lost 1-1/2 to 25-1/4 in heavy trading.
Overall, losers beat gainers 2286 to 2098 on total volume of 629 million shares.
